title: Why did the Renaissance start in Italy? - Quora

response.answer_text: There are many reasons why the Renaissance started in Italy, but the one I most often refer to is the fact that it’s a re-birth (Re-Naissance) of European civilization and literature, much of which was born in Italy and Greece a thousand years previous. Also, at the time of the Renaissance, many Greek scholars were fleeing the Byzantine empire, which was being conquered by the Turks at the time. Many of those Greek scholars migrated to Italy and brought a wealth of Classical literature and knowledge with them.

It started earlier when a copy of Emperor Justinian's Corpus Iuris Ciuilis was discovered in Bologna in 1070. By 1088 the University of Bologna was founded as the first university and law school in Europe. For the first time learning could be acquired outside of monasteries. Fun fact: baloney was earlier defined as obfuscating language before it was named for the sausage.
